notes.title: What is Law?
notes.content:
Law is a system of rules created and enforced through social or governmental institutions to regulate behavior. It serves several purposes:

• Maintaining order in society
• Protecting individual rights
• Resolving disputes
• Promoting justice and fairness

notes.title: Sources of Law
notes.content:
The main sources of law include:

1. Primary Sources:
   • Constitution
   • Statutes/Legislation
   • Case Law/Judicial Decisions
   • Regulations

2. Secondary Sources:
   • Legal encyclopedias
   • Law journals
   • Legal commentaries

notes.title: Classification of Law
notes.content:
Law can be classified in various ways:

• Public Law vs Private Law
• Criminal Law vs Civil Law
• Substantive Law vs Procedural Law
• Municipal Law vs International Law
• Written Law vs Unwritten Law
